titlStmt.titl: Codebook for an IPUMS-PMA Data Extract
titlStmt.subTitl: DDI 2.5 metadata describing the extract file 'pma_00008.dat'

prodStmt.prodPlac: Minnesota Population Center, 50 Willey Hall, 225 - 19th Avenue South, Minneapolis, MN 55455

stdyInfo.notes: Additional notes on a sample that is part of this study: ; regular size
Additional notes on a sample that is part of this study: ; regular size

useStmt.citReq:
Publications and research reports based on the IPUMS-PMA database must cite it appropriately. The citation should include the following:
Elizabeth Heger Boyle, Devon Kristiansen, and Matthew Sobek. IPUMS-PMA: Version 1.0 [dataset] Minneapolis, MN: IPUMS, 2018. https://doi.org/10.18128/D081.V1.0
The licensing agreement for use of IPUMS-PMA data requires that users supply us with the title and full citation for any publications, research reports, or educational materials making use of the data or documentation. Please add your citation to the IPUMS bibliography at http://bibliography.ipums.org/.
useStmt.conditions:
Users of IPUMS-PMA data must agree to abide by the conditions of use. A user's license is valid for one year and may be renewed. Users must agree to the following conditions:
(1) No fees may be charged for use or distribution of the data.
(2) Cite IPUMS appropriately. For information on proper citation, refer to the citation requirement section of this DDI document.
(3) Tell us about any work you do using the IPUMS. Publications, research reports, or presentations making use of IPUMS-PMA should be added to our Bibliography. Continued funding for the IPUMS depends on our ability to show our sponsor agencies that researchers are using the data for productive purposes.
(4) The IPUMS cannot be used for genealogical research
(5) It is difficult to use the IPUMS to study small geographic areas. In the IPUMS census samples for years 1940-present, no places having a population of fewer than 100,000 persons can be identified.
(6) Use it for GOOD -- never for EVIL.
(7) Please notify ipums@umn.edu regarding errors in the data or documentation.
useStmt.disclaimer: The user of the data acknowledges that the original collector of the data, the authorized distributor of the data, and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences based upon such uses.

fileTxt.filePlac: Minnesota Population Center, 50 Willey Hall, 225 - 19th Avenue South, Minneapolis, MN 55455

var.name: SAMPLE
var.txt: SAMPLE is an IPUMS-generated variable that identifies the PMA sample from which the record is drawn. In some countries and years, PMA conducts more than one round of the survey. The data from each round are separately identified. In some cases, data from the same country and same round might have been split into more than one file according to geographic region.

catgry.labl: Ethiopia 2016/7 Maternal and Newborn Health Round 1

var.name: COUNTRY
var.txt: COUNTRY reports the country where the survey was fielded.

var.name: YEAR
var.txt: YEAR reports the year when the survey was fielded. Some interviews may have occurred early in the following year. YEAR does not reflect individual interview years.

var.name: ROUND
var.labl: PMA survey round in this country
var.txt: ROUND reports the survey round within a given country (1st, 2nd, etc.). In some cases, more than one round of the survey was fielded in the same year.
var.codInstr: ROUND is an integer variable that represents the round of the survey within that country.

var.name: EAID
var.txt:
EAID reports the geographic enumeration area where the respondent was located. The EAID is the primary sampling unit for IPUMS PMA. Due to privacy concerns, the borders of these enumeration areas are not publicly available and the enumeration area is specified via an assigned number rather than a recognized name for a locale.
Enumeration areas do not cover all areas within each survey country. After 5 survey rounds using the same enumeration areas, PMA identifies new enumeration areas. Due to this sampling design, some households, eligible women respondents, or service delivery points might be selected to be interviewed in more than one survey within a 5 year period. The variables PREVINTERVIEWHQ, PREVINTERVIEWFQ, and PREVINTERVIEWSQ identifies household, female, and service delivery point respondents, respectively, who have been interviewed for PMA in a previous round. It is not possible, however, to link survey records for the same person between rounds.
var.codInstr: This is a 10-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: FACILITYID
var.txt: FACILITYID is a numeric variable that identifies the service delivery point facility. FACILITYID remains constant across survey rounds, so records of the same facility can be linked between samples of the same country.

var.name: CONSENTSQ
var.txt: CONSENTSQ indicates whether the respondent to the service delivery point questionnaire consented to be interviewed.

var.name: STRATA
var.txt:
STRATA defines the stratification for each sample. Some countries use only urban/rural stratification, others use regions, and some use both levels of stratification. Users may use STRATA and EAID (the primary sampling unit) to adjust sampling errors to account for sampling design of IPUMS-PMA samples.
For more information on sample design for IPUMS-PMA surveys, see the sampling design memo [URL omitted from DDI.] for households and women.

var.name: EASERVED
var.txt:
EASERVED provides a series of up to 42 variables that represent the geographic enumeration areas served by the service delivery point (SDP). Service delivery points can serve more than one enumeration area. Additional areas served by the service delivery point (if any) are recorded in EASERVED2, EASERVED3, etc. The information in EASERVED is available only for public service delivery points and is based on reports from the local or national government. Note that the EASERVED variables may also contain the code for the EA the SDP is located in.
Due to privacy concerns, the borders of enumeration areas are not publicly available. The enumeration area is specified via an assigned number rather than a recognized name for a locale. The codes for EASERVED variables series identify the same areas as the corresponding codes in EAID (Enumeration area) in the data from household, female, and service delivery point surveys. The numbering of EAIDs is consistent across survey rounds for a country. Codes are also unique among countries.

var.name: EASERVED1
var.txt:
EASERVED1 reports a geographic enumeration area served by the service delivery point. Service delivery points can serve more than one enumeration area. Additional areas served by the service delivery point (if any) are recorded in EASERVED2, EASERVED3, etc. The information in EASERVED1 is available only for public service delivery points and is based on reports from the local or national government.
Due to privacy concerns, the borders of enumeration areas are not publicly available. The enumeration area is specified via an assigned number rather than a recognized name for a locale. The codes for EASERVED1 identify the same areas as the corresponding codes in EAID (Enumeration area) in the data from household, female, and service delivery point surveys. The numbering of EAIDs is consistent across survey rounds for a country. Codes are also unique among countries.

var.name: FACILITYTYPE
var.txt:
FACILITYTYPE reports the type of facility of the interviewed service delivery point.
The variable FACILITYTYPEGEN is a recode of FACILITYTYPE that reduces the coding scheme to nine general categories.

catgry.labl: Centre de la Mere de l'Enfant

var.name: FACILITYTYPEGEN
var.txt:
FACILITYTYPEGEN reports the type of facility of the interviewed service delivery point in nine general categories. A related variable (FACILITYTYPE) also reports the facility type, and retains all details from country-specific response categories.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: AUTHORITY
var.txt:
AUTHORITY reports the managing authority of the facility.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CONPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, CONPROV reports if the service delivery point provides male condoms.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CYCBPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, CYCBPROV reports if the service delivery point provides cycle beads.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: DEPOPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, DEPOPROV indicates whether the service delivery point provides Depo Provera.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: DIAPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, DIAPROV reports if the service delivery point provides diaphragms.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: EMRGPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, EMRGPROV reports if the service delivery point provides emergency contraceptive.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: FCPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, FCPROV reports if the service delivery point provides female condoms.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: FSTPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, FSTPROV reports if the service delivery point provides female sterilization.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: FJPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, FJPROV reports if the service delivery point provides spermicidal foam or jelly.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IMPPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, IMPPROV reports if the service delivery point provides implants.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IUDPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, IUDPROV reports if the service delivery point provides IUDs.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: MSTPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, MSTPROV reports if the service delivery point provides male sterilization.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: PILLPROV
var.txt:
For service delivery points that offer family planning services and products, PILLPROV reports if the service delivery point provides birth control pills.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: SAYPROV
var.txt:
SAYPROV indicates whether the service delivery point provides Sayana Press injectable contraception.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CONOBS
var.labl: Observed and in/out stock: male condoms
var.txt:
CONOBS indicates whether facilities that provide male condoms currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CONOUT3MO
var.txt:
CONOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with male condoms in-stock at the time of the interview (see CONOBS) had ever been out of stock of male condoms within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CONOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days male condoms have been out of stock
var.txt:
CONOUTDAY reports how many days male condoms have been out of stock (see CONOBS) from a facility that normally provides male condoms (see CONPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CYCBOBS
var.txt:
CYCBOBS indicates whether facilities that provide Standard Days / Cycle Beads currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CYCBOUT3MO
var.txt:
CYCBOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with Standard Days / Cycle Beads in-stock at the time of the interview (see CYCBOBS) had ever been out of stock of Standard Days / Cycle Beads within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: CYCBOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days beads have been out of stock
var.txt:
CYCBOUTDAY reports how many days Standard Days / Cycle Beads have been out of stock (see CYCBOBS) from a facility that normally provides Standard Days / Cycle Beads (see CYCBPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: DEPOOBS
var.labl: Observed and in/out stock: Depo Provera
var.txt:
DEPOOBS indicates whether facilities that provide Depo-Provera currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: DEPOOUT3MO
var.txt:
DEPOOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with Depo-Provera in-stock at the time of the interview (see DEPOOBS) had ever been out of stock of Depo-Provera within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: DEPOOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days depo provera has been out of stock
var.txt:
DEPOOUTDAY reports how many days Depo-Provera have been out of stock (see DEPOOBS) from a facility that normally provides Depo-Provera (see DEPOPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: DIAOBS
var.txt:
DIAOBS indicates whether facilities that provide diaphragms currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.

var.txt:

var.txt:

var.txt:
FCOBS indicates whether facilities that provide female condoms currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.

var.txt:
FCOUTDAY reports how many days female condoms have been out of stock (see FCOBS) from a facility that normally provides female condoms (see FCPROV).

var.name: FJOBS
var.labl: Observed and in/out stock: foam / jelly
var.txt:
FJOBS indicates whether facilities that provide contraceptive foam / jelly currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: FJOUT3MO
var.txt:
FJOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with contraceptive foam / jelly in-stock at the time of the interview (see FJOBS) had ever been out of stock of contraceptive foam / jelly within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: FJOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days foam/jelly has been out of stock
var.txt:
FJOUTDAY reports how many days contraceptive foam / jelly have been out of stock (see FJOBS) from a facility that normally provides contraceptive foam / jelly (see FJPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IMPOBS
var.txt:
IMPOBS indicates whether facilities that provide contraceptive implants currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IMPOUT3MO
var.txt:
IMPOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with contraceptive implants in-stock at the time of the interview (see IMPOBS) had ever been out of stock of contraceptive implants within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IMPOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days implants have been out of stock
var.txt:
IMPOUTDAY reports how many days contraceptive implants have been out of stock (see IMPOBS) from a facility that normally provides contraceptive implants (see IMPPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IUDOBS
var.labl: IUDs are observed and in stock in the facility
var.txt:
IUDOBS indicates whether facilities that provide IUDs currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IUDOUT3MO
var.txt:
IUDOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with IUDs in-stock at the time of the interview (see IUDOBS) had ever been out of stock of IUDs within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: IUDOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days IUDs have been out of stock
var.txt:
IUDOUTDAY reports how many days IUDs have been out of stock (see IUDOBS) from a facility that normally provides IUDs (see IUDPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: PILLOBS
var.txt:
PILLOBS indicates whether facilities that provide contraceptive pills currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: PILLOUT3MO
var.txt:
PILLOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with contraceptive pills in-stock at the time of the interview (see PILLOBS) had ever been out of stock of contraceptive pills within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: PILLOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days birth control pills have been out of stock
var.txt:
PILLOUTDAY reports how many days contraceptive pills have been out of stock (see PILLOBS) from a facility that normally provides contraceptive pills (see PILLPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: SAYOBS
var.labl: Observed and in/out stock: Sayana Press
var.txt:
SAYOBS indicates whether facilities that provide Sayana Press currently have supplies in-stock. Some samples report whether or not the interviewer observed the stock; see the Comparability tab.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: SAYOUT3MO
var.txt:
SAYOUT3MO indicates whether facilities with Sayana Press in-stock at the time of the interview (see SAYOBS) had ever been out of stock of Sayana Press within the last 3 months.
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.

var.name: SAYOUTDAY
var.labl: Number of days sayana press has been out of stock
var.txt:
SAYOUTDAY reports how many days Sayana Press have been out of stock (see SAYOBS) from a facility that normally provides Sayana Press (see SAYPROV).
The question associated with this variable was included in the service delivery point questionnaire.
